alert.note: Alert for Santa Rosa (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 09 at 10:15PM EDT until September 10 at 2:15AM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Florida, including the following counties, Escambia and Santa Rosa. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 914 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pensacola, West Pensacola, Warrington, Gulf Breeze, Oriole Beach, Brownsville and Woodlawn Beach.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
